title: LightGuide
description: A Light Guide coupling between the light source and the microscope generally consists of a casing enclosing a medium capable of transferring light from the illuminator to the back of the microsocpe body.

subCategoriesOrder.ManufacturerSpec: This describes the manufacturer specifications for this component (i.e., manufacturer name, model designation and serial number).
subCategoriesOrder.LightSourceCoupling: This element describes the device(s)/method(s) used to couple the available light source(s) with this microscope body in order to transfer light to the specimen. A typical light-microscope has a light coupling device for each available light source.
subCategoriesOrder.LightGuide: A Light Guide coupling between the light source and the microscope generally consists of a casing enclosing a medium capable of transferring light from the illuminator to the back of the microsocpe body.
subCategoriesOrder.CouplingLens: This is a reference to a lens positioned at the connection between this light source coupling element and the microscope body.
subCategoriesOrder.WavelengthRange: This records a range of wavelengths this device is designed for according to the manufacturer. Multiple of this elements may be used.

Type.description: The type of light guide used in this case.

PeakWavelength.description: The wavelength associated with the transmittance peak for this light guide.

RefractiveIndex.description: The refractive index of the material this light guide is made of.

NumericalAperture.description: The numerical aperture of this light guide expressed as a floating point (real) number. Expected range 0.02 - 1.5.

AcceptanceAngle.description: The angle within which the light beam produced by a light source may be coupled with the bound modes of this light guide.

Geometry.description: The shape of this light guide.

MaterialName.description: The chemical composition or the non-proprietary trade designation of the material used for this light guide.

SingleMode.description: Whether or not this light guide is single-mode. If not, then the guide is assumend to be multi-modal.

WaveguideMode.description: The transverse mode (or superposition of such modes) that are being imposed by this light guide onto the light wave traversing it. These modes generally follow different propagation constants.

Diameter.description: The outer diameter of this light guide.

Name.description: A user defined name for this component.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this component.

Transmittance.description: The maximum amount of light this LightSourceCoupling apparatus is capable of transmitting at the peak wavelenght. It is represented as a fractional value from 0.0 to 1.0.

SerialNumber.description: The serial number of this component

LotNumber.description: The lot number of this component

SpecsFile.description: Provide the location of a PDF file with the specifications for the component as provided by the manufacturer.

CouplingLens.description: This is a reference to a lens positioned at the connection between this light source coupling element and the microscope body.

Description.title: Description
Description.description: This is a simple multi-line comment or annotation describing this component.

WavelengthRange.description: This records a range of wavelengths this device is designed for, according to the manufacturer. Multiple of this elements may be used.

CutIn.description: CutIn is the wavelength below which the response rate is below 50%.

CutOut.description: CutOut is the wavelength above which the response rate is below 50%.

WavelenghtProfile.description: The location of a file containing the wavelenght profile of this component.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
